net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.database.sqlitehouse

Class SQLightable.Reflection<T extends SQLightable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.database.sqlitehouse.SQLightable.Reflection<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the class being reflected
    Enclosing interface:
    SQLightable

    public static class SQLightable.Reflection<T extends SQLightable>
extends java.lang.Object
    A full reflection of a SQLightable object, which represents, and is used to marshal data for, an SQLite table. Usable by SQLiteHouse and any other class that needs to know how this table class is defined.
    Since:
    zerobandwidth-net/android 0.1.7 (#50)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  SQLightable.Reflection.Column
      A full reflection of a SQLiteColumn field.
      static class  SQLightable.Reflection.ColumnMap<ST extends SQLightable>
      Provides a syntactic shorthand for working with maps of fields to column reflections.

      The field that is the class's placeholder for the magic SQLite auto-incremented row key, if any.

      A map of DB column names to field definitions.

      A map of fields to their column schemas.
      protected java.lang.String m_sTableName
      The name of the table.

      • getTableName

        public static <ST extends SQLightable> java.lang.String getTableName(java.lang.Class<ST> cls)
        Standardized way to choose the name of a SQLite table based on the schematic class definition and its annotations, if any.
        Type Parameters:
        ST - the schematic class
        Parameters:
        cls - the schematic class
        Returns:
        either the name specified in the annotation, or a lower-cased transformation of the class name itself, if the annotation is not provided

      • getTableName

        protected static <ST extends SQLightable> java.lang.String getTableName(java.lang.Class<ST> cls,
                                                                        SQLiteTable antTable)
        Standardized way to choose the name of a SQLite table based on the annotation attached to the schematic class.
        Type Parameters:
        ST - the schematic class
        Parameters:
        cls - the schematic class
        antTable - the annotation that describes the table defined by the class (may be null)
        Returns:
        either the name specified in the annotation, or a lower-cased transformation of the class name itself, if the annotation is not present
        See Also:
        getTableName(Class), getTableName()

      • buildInsert

        public static <ST extends SQLightable> InsertionBuilder buildInsert(java.lang.Class<ST> cls)
        Shorthand to get an instance of InsertionBuilder initialized with the table name that would be reflected for the specified schematic class. Use this method when you need a query builder but don't need to retain a copy of the reflection.
        Type Parameters:
        ST - the schematic class
        Parameters:
        cls - the schematic class
        Returns:
        a builder for an INSERT statement

      • getTableClass

        public java.lang.Class<T> getTableClass()
        Accesses the schematic class reflected in this object.
        Returns:
        the class reflected in this object

      • getTableAttrs

        public SQLiteTable getTableAttrs()
        Accesses the SQLiteTable annotation that defines the attributes of the table described by this schematic class.
        Returns:
        the annotation of table attributes

      • getTableName

        public java.lang.String getTableName()
        Accesses the name of the database table described by this schematic class. If the name is not explicitly given in an annotation, then it will be derived by lower-casing the simple name of the schematic class itself.
        Returns:
        the name of the table
        See Also:
        getTableName(Class, SQLiteTable)

      • getField

        public java.lang.reflect.Field getField(java.lang.String sColName)
        Accesses the field in the schematic class corresponding to the name of a column in the table described by the class.
        Parameters:
        sColName - the name of a column in the database table
        Returns:
        the field in this schematic class which corresponds to that column

      • getColumnMap

        public SQLightable.Reflection.ColumnMap<T> getColumnMap()
        Accesses the complete map of fields and column reflections.
        Returns:
        the complete map of fields and columns

      • getColumnDef

        public SQLightable.Reflection.Column getColumnDef(java.lang.reflect.Field fld)
        Accesses the SQLite column definition defined by the given field in the schematic class.
        Parameters:
        fld - the field that corresponds to a database table column
        Returns:
        a reflection of that column

      • getColumnDef

        public SQLightable.Reflection.Column getColumnDef(java.lang.String sColName)
        Accesses the SQLite column definition for the given column name.
        Parameters:
        sColName - the name of the table column
        Returns:
        a reflection of that column

      • getKeyField

        public java.lang.reflect.Field getKeyField()
        Accesses the field that was defined as the practical key for the table.
        Returns:
        the field usable as a key

      • getKeyColumn

        public SQLightable.Reflection.Column getKeyColumn()
        Accesses the column reflection for the field defined as the practical key for the table.
        Returns:
        the reflection of the table's key column

      • getMagicIDField

        public java.lang.reflect.Field getMagicIDField()
        Accesses the field that was defined as the container for the SQLite magic auto-incremented row ID, if any.
        Returns:
        the field which holds the auto-inc row ID

      • getMagicIDColumn

        public SQLightable.Reflection.Column getMagicIDColumn()
        Accesses the column reflection for the field defined as the container for the SQLite magic auto-incremented row ID, if any.
        Returns:
        the reflection of the table's row ID column

      • getKeyOrMagicIDColumn

        public SQLightable.Reflection.Column getKeyOrMagicIDColumn()
        Tries to find a usable key column, by first looking for a field defined as the practical key, then looking for a field defined as the magic auto-incremented row ID, then returning null if neither is defined.
        Returns:
        a column usable as a key, or null if neither a practical key nor a magic row ID column is defined

      • getTableCreationSQL

        public java.lang.String getTableCreationSQL()
        Generates the SQL statement which will create the table represented by this schematic class, based on the class itself, and its SQLiteTable annotation (if any).
        Returns:
        an SQL statement which will create the SQLite table

      • getAddColumnSQL

        public java.lang.String getAddColumnSQL(SQLightable.Reflection.Column col)
        Generates the SQL statement which will add the specified column to this table.
        Parameters:
        col - the reflection of the column to be added
        Returns:
        an SQL statement which adds the column to this table

      • getFirstSchemaVersion

        public int getFirstSchemaVersion()
        Determines the first version of the schema in which this schematic class was included. If the SQLiteTable annotation is missing, then the method returns 1.
        Returns:
        the schema version in which the schematic class was introduced

      • getInstance

        public T getInstance()
              throws IntrospectionException
        Constructs an empty instance of the SQLightable implementation class reflected in this object.
        Returns:
        an empty instance of the schematic class
        Throws:
        IntrospectionException - if the schematic class could not be constructed for some reason

      • fromCursor

        public T fromCursor(android.database.Cursor crs)
             throws IntrospectionException,
                    SchematicException
        Reads a row of data from the specified cursor, and marshals it into a schematic class instance corresponding to the table from which the row was fetched.
        Parameters:
        crs - the cursor which is currently pointing to a data row
        Returns:
        an instance of the class, containing the cursor's current row
        Throws:
        IntrospectionException - if the data class could not be constructed for some reason
        SchematicException - if the data could not be properly marshalled into the class instance

      • fromBundle

        public T fromBundle(android.os.Bundle bndl)
             throws IntrospectionException,
                    SchematicException
        Reads fields from a supplied Bundle, and marshals it into a schematic class instance.
        Parameters:
        bndl - the bundle into which data was marshalled
        Returns:
        an instance of the class, containing the bundled data
        Throws:
        IntrospectionException - if the data class could not be constructed for some reason
        SchematicException - if the data could not be properly marshalled into the class instance

      • toContentValues

        public android.content.ContentValues toContentValues(T oSource)
                                              throws SchematicException
        Extracts the values of all known fields, corresponding to database table columns, from a schematic class instance, and returns a ContentValues instance containing those values. Replaces SQLiteHouse#toContentValues(SQLightable).
        Parameters:
        oSource - the object to be processed
        Returns:
        the values that would be stored in the database
        Throws:
        SchematicException - if no Refractor implementation can be found for one of the columns/fields

      • toBundle

        public android.os.Bundle toBundle(T oSource)
                           throws SchematicException
        Extracts the values of all known fields, corresponding to database table columns, from a schematic class instance, and returns a Bundle instance containing those values.
        Parameters:
        oSource - the object to be processed
        Returns:
        the values that would be stored in the database
        Throws:
        SchematicException - if no Refractor implementation can be found for one of the column's fields
